response:
In order to complete a BS in computer science, you have to complete 4 computer science electives, the general education requirements as outlined by the Lincoln Program, and the following classes and all their prerequisites:
$prereqs(CS000)

The Lincoln Program is the general education requirement set by the university on all students. The specific courses required by the Lincoln Program can be found here:
https://www.siue.edu/registrar/genedguides.shtml

There are two withdrawal deadlines. If you withdraw from a class before March 24th, you will receive a W on your transcript and it will not affect your overall GPA. You may still withdraw until April 14th and receive a WP or WF depending on if you were passing the class at the time of your withdrawal. A WP will not affect your GPA, but a WF counts as a failing grade for the purposes of GPA. More information is available here:
https://www.siue.edu/registrar/class/dropping.shtml

As part of a BS in computer science, you are required to take 4 electives, worth a total 12 credit hours, the classes that qualify include:
$prereqs(CS002)

You have to take $prereqs(m[0]) before you can take $number(m[0]).
```$prereq_tree(m[0])```
This semester $number(m[0]) is being taught by $teachers(m[0]).
